Fund## Swing Trader Style Post

Solana (SOL) swing plan I am running right now:

Context
SOL is grinding higher with the market from the lowâ€‘$120s, still well below prior highs and trading in a wider range rather than in a clean trend.
Thesis
I like SOLâ€™s medium term setup. Strong ecosystem, active DeFi and RWA growth, but price is still weighed down by previous distribution. I treat this as a range to accumulate, not something to chase vertically.
Entry Plan
I am scaling in, not aping in.
Starter size around current levels in the lowâ€‘$120s.
Add if we see a dip toward the highâ€‘teens.
Only if the market really flushes, final add in the lowâ€‘$110s.
Size gets larger the lower we go so my best size is closer to the prior swing lows.
Invalidation And Risk
I run two layers of risk control.
Local stops sit just below each level I am keying off, so if a zone fails hard I do not bag hold that tranche.
Structural invalidation is if SOL starts accepting well below the recent lows on strong volume. At that point I assume the range has broken and I am prepared to cut most or all of the position.
Breakout Plan
If SOL breaks and holds above the lowâ€‘$130s, I stop assuming we will revisit the deep bids.
I cancel or move up most of the lowâ€‘$110s orders.
I then treat former resistance as potential support and look for pullbacks above that zone instead of waiting forever for â€œperfectâ€ .

Canton Coin Surges After DTCC Eyes US Treasury Tokenization.  What Drove Canton Coinâ€™s Weekly Surge? Canton Coin climbed about 27% over the past week, outperforming a flat-to-weaker crypto market as traders responded to fresh signs of institutional adoption. The move followed a Dec. 17 announcement from the Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation outlining plans to tokenize a portion of US Treasury securities on the Canton Network.  The timing mattered. While Canton Coin advanced, most large-cap assets drifted lower. Bitcoin and Ether slipped around 0.5%, BNB fell close to 0.9%, and Solana dropped more than 3%, according to CoinGecko data. Against that backdrop, the rally stood out as a trade tied less to market beta and more to infrastructure news  ï»¿$BTC  #BTC Price Analysis#  $SOL  #Macro Insights#

Crypto solved finance first. Now itâ€™s coming for ownership ğŸ‘€  Campâ€™s north star is giving IP the same first-class treatment that tokens and accounts got in the early crypto era - e.g, tokens like $SOL  and $ADA .  IP is inevitable.  Today, intellectual property powers the internet but lives in broken, offline systems: slow licensing, no provenance, and zero programmatic rights.  That model collapses in an AI-native world.  As AI agents scale, every creation, remix, and usage becomes a transaction, and legacy architectures simply canâ€™t keep up.  Camp changes the stack.  Every IP registration, license, derivation, and royalty becomes an onchain primitive, with the performance needed for real-time execution and agent-scale coordination.  This is the missing layer.  Camp is building the IP monetization and rights infrastructure for the AI-native era ğŸ§   #Altcoin Season#

ğŸ„ Christmas Hack Hits Trust Wallet: $7M Lost

What should have been a quiet holiday turned into a nightmare for hundreds of crypto users. On Dec 25, 2025, @TrustWallet confirmed that its browser extension v2.68 was exploited, draining nearly $7 million in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, and other assets.

ğŸ” Key Details
- Malicious code slipped into the Chrome extension update.
- Users who imported seed phrases into v2.68 unknowingly exposed private keys.
- ~600 wallets drained, total losses ~$7M.
- SlowMist reported the extension exported personal data, suggesting insider activity.
- Trust Wallet released a patched version (v2.89) and urged immediate upgrades.
- Binance CEO CZ confirmed all victims will be reimbursed through the SAFU fund.

Over $6 million has been siphoned from Trust Wallet users in a sophisticated attack, leaving many scrambling for answers.

The breach targeted Ethereum and Solana wallets linked to old accounts.

Hereâ€™s how it unfolded. 
2/ The exploit struck wallets linked to addresses created between November 2022 and May 2023.

Victims reported unauthorized withdrawals across multiple tokens,

with some accounts drained despite no recent activity or exposure to phishing scams.
3/ The pattern of affected wallets suggests attackers used a method that bypassed common phishing tactics.

This raises concerns about potential vulnerabilities in wallet software and security models for users with dormant accounts.
4/ As stolen funds move quickly through cross-chain bridges, the complexity of recovering assets grows.

The incident signals a need for heightened vigilance and ongoing updates in wallet security to protect user assets.

Altcoin season keeps getting treated like a weather forecast espeically on X but it really is not. It is liquidity, and liquidity has opinions.

The market sits at around $3.03T where BTC sat at $87.8k, ETH at $2.95k and BTC dominance was still around 58â€“59%. The Altcoin Season Index was 15/100. That is not rotation sadly but that is Bitcoin letting a few passengers stand up to stretch their legs.

I have watched this movie in every cycle. When BTC is the reserve asset, capital hides there first, then it peeks out into a handful of â€œsafeâ€ alts, and only then does it leak into the long tail. You do not get a real altcoin season while dominance holds near 60% but you need sustained deterioration toward 55% plus breadth & not just Solana or a narrative pump.

The stablecoin base is big (the piece I keep watching), but it is cautious money. It sits. It waits. It does not chase.

If youâ€™re a founder, we have to keep buildibg external demand and not just community liquidity. Also if you are hiring, you should really optimize for operators who can ship during Bitcoin Season. The capital rotation always comes later but the teams are built now.
